unit_learning_outcomes.description: Identify and pursue business opportunities, and create value for all stakeholders.
Develop comprehensive knowledge business planning, financial management and technology management to develop successful ventures.
Apply the fundamental knowledge and theoretical frameworks related to entrepreneurial behaviour in business management.
Apply the process of capturing market and customer needs and converting these to a viable and sustainable products.
Build an entrepreneurial mindset for value creation in existing business and create new business.

assessments.description: Midterm group project and team work activity
Written report on a new venture with the purpose of gaining funding to start the business
Active Engagement and Contribution in the tutorial activities

data.unit_offering_text:
Session 1, Weekday attendance, North Ryde
Session 1, Special circumstances
data.description: The aim of this unit is to provide students with entrepreneurial skills that are needed to build scalable startups in addition to entrepreneurial behaviours that are required to work in organisations within an engineering context. It will provide students with fundamental knowledge and procedures of creating successful ventures. The course will include the process of understanding customer requirements and converting these into specifications of a product and then designing a process to produce these. The course will also include other aspects that support entrepreneurship such as business planning, financial management, sources of finance, crowdfunding, entrepreneurial behaviour and technology management.
data.title: Engineering Entrepreneurship
